thread.title: Manchester United star posts injury update ahead of EFL Cup final
thread.title_full: Manchester United star posts injury update ahead of EFL Cup final

author: Scott Morris
title: Manchester United star posts injury update ahead of EFL Cup final
text:
Manchester United star posts injury update ahead of EFL Cup final By Scott Morris on Wednesday, February 22, 2017 Race against time? 
Henrikh Mkhitaryan has posted an update on his injury having limped out of Manchester United ‘s Europa League clash with Saint-Etienne. 
The Armenian international is an early doubt for Sunday’s EFL Cup final against Southampton in which will be a huge blow. 
Mkhitaryan has hit form having been criticised following several disappointing performances at the beginning of the season. 
Now, the player has become an important player in a squad that is impressing at this stage of the season. 
Henrikh took to social media to update fans on his injury, and it does not look like good news. 
The player confirmed he is back in his homeland following the injury and ends the post with ‘fingers crossed’. Back in the country where I spent my childhood. So happy to have scored, but sad to have left the pitch that early. Fingers crossed #mufc pic.twitter.com/nDXczXCoIH 
— Henrikh Mkhitaryan (@HenrikhMkh) February 22, 2017 United looking for silverware 
The Red Devils are in the hunt for several pieces of silverware this season, with their first final on Sunday in the EFL Cup. 
United could now be without Mkhitaryan and Michael Carrick who also looked to have struggled with injury. 
Regardless, the club are still fighting in the FA Cup, EFL Cup, Europa League and Premier League. 
Should the club even pull off just one of them or maybe two, that would be impressive for Mourinho’s first season. Winner Betting Odds
